item.title: Navigating the Digital Shift: Best Practices for Digital Tax Return Management in Tax Administration
item.description: In an era where digital transformation is reshaping every aspect of our lives, tax administrations worldwide are embracing the shift towards digitalization, particularly in tax return management. For tax authorities in Latin America and the Caribbean, this transition offers significant benefits in terms of efficiency, compliance, and revenue collection. Here, we delve into effective methods for long-term digital tax return storage, explore top technologies including blockchain, emphasize the advantages of data mining and statistics, and share experiences and best practices from the field.

item.title: The Reality of Blockchain in Tax and Financial Administration Systems: Promises, Pitfalls, and Progress
item.description:
In recent years, blockchain technology has been heralded as a revolutionary force in various sectors, including tax and financial administration systems. However, as the initial hype subsides, it’s crucial to examine the real-world applications, challenges, and ongoing efforts in this domain from a skeptical perspective.

Real Uses of Blockchain in ITAS and IFAS

While blockchain has been touted as a panacea for many administrative challenges, its actual implementation in tax and financial systems has been more limited than initially predicted.

item.title: Argentum
item.description:
Some time ago, together with Alejandro Baranek, after a meeting with the creators of a digital currency called Moneda Par, we developed the theoretical framework for a digital currency that would solve some of the existing problems in Argentina at that time, mainly inflation.

As a result, Argentum emerged, whose paper can be consulted here.
